page.title: 07THE MEDIA AROUND BRADFORD
page.content: { RADIO: }The local radio is a commercial station situated in Pennine House Forster Square. It is called {Pennine Radio }and its wavelength is 235m Medium wave. It broadcasts seven days per week for 24 hours a day. It covers the area of Bradford and West Yorkshire. The{BBC}national network is covered in this area by{Radio Leeds. { NEWSPAPERS:}Bradford has a good local {evening daily}called the{Telegraph and {Argus. }It was established in 1868 and its {circulation today is 86,000. }It covers the area Bradford, Aire Valley, Calderdale, Spenborough & Wharfe valley. The new, glass fronted, T&A Press Hall Building was opened in 1981 and has had a mixed reaction because of its modern design in an old city. There is also a {free }local newspaper called{'The Star'. } About {114,000}copies are delivered{weekly.
